result.execSummary:
On one or more charges in this case, Marcel Kudzin was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Hilary Edwards & Atty Angela Komp.  State ready to proceed to disposition today.  Atty Edwards requests an adjournment to get an updated report on the deft's progress.  Court denies the adjournment request.  Victim rights compliance.  Court will proceed today to disposition.  Parties previously stipulated to NGI.  Sentencing arguments made.  Court's finding - deft is not guilty by mental disease and institutional care is necessary.  Deft is committed to the Dept of Health Services on count 1 - duration of his life, count 2 - for a period of 40yrs, count 3 - for a period of 3yrs, & count 4 - for a period of 6yrs.  All sentences are consecutive.  Deft is committed to the custody of the sheriff for transport to a facility.  Firearm warning.  Appeal rights.
Victim Impact Statements from the family of James Nelson

Minutes:  Day 4.  Clerk/T. Lema and Clerk - CJ @ 3:50 PM.  Same appearances.  Jury instruction conference held.  Court conducts colliquey with deft regarding the lesser included verdicts.  Deft concurs with offering the lesser included verdicts with counts 3 & 4.  Jurors reconvene @ 9:43am.  Defense rests @ 9:43am.  No rebuttal.  Final instructions given to the jury.  Closing arguments given.  Jurors released @ 12:12pm; instructed to return @ 1:30pm.  Jurors reconvene @ 1:38pm.  Alternate jurors - Tammi G. & Paul T.  Jurors commence deliberations @ 1:45pm. Verdict reached @ 5:21 PM. Jurors reconvene at 5:24 PM. Court states verdict forms are not filled in correctly; Jurors re-instructed and sent back to complete verdicts at 5:27 PM. Jurors reconvene and verdict read in to the record @ 5:31 PM. 
Ct 1 - Jury finds the DE guilty w/ enhancer.  Ct 2 - Jury finds the DE guilty w/ enhancer.  Ct 3 - Jury finds the DE guilty w/ enhancer. Ct 4 - Jury finds the DE guilty w/ enhancer. Jurors polled.  Jurors released @ 5:37 PM. State requests entry of judgment on all counts. Court withholds entry of judgment. Parties waive PSI. Bond revoked. BR 3 clerk to contact parties tomorrow to set up date for further proceedings.

Minutes:  Day 3.  Clerk/T. Lema.  Same appearances.  Jury instruction conference held.  ADA Binger filed a motion in limine last night - briefly addressed.  Jurors reconvene @ 10:58am.  Defense case commences.  Defense witness - Marcel Kudzin (deft).  Testimony of deft interrupted during direct-examination to handle an objection/sidebar.  Jurors excused @ 11:47am; instructed to return @ 1:20pm.  Jurors reconvene @ 1:40pm.  Testimony resumes - Marcel Kudzin (direct examination).  Court takes a short recess to discuss whether to include lesser verdicts; jurors excused from courtroom.  Court decides to send the jurors home for the day.  Jurors released @ 3:15pm; instructed to return @ 9am on 2/20/20.  Arguments resume on the lesser included verdicts.  As to counts 1 & 2 - court denies the request for lesser incl verdict.  As to counts 3 & 4 - court will allow a lesser included verdict.
Submitted by ADA Thomas Binger

Minutes:  Day 2.  Clerk/T. Lema.  Same appearances.  Jurors reconvene @ 9:27am.  Testimony continues.  State's witnesses - Greg Munnelly (prior KPD), Amonte A. & KPD Sheskey.  Jurors released for lunch @ 11:45am; to return @ 1pm.  Jurors reconvene @ 1:08pm.  Testimony continues.  State's witnesses - Colleen L., Dr. Emily Hansen, Det. Brandi Valeri, Det. Martin Howard, & Dr. Wiliam Falco.  State rests.  Jurors released @ 4:35pm; instructed to return @ 10am on 2/19/20
Juror Selection & Peremptory Challenges

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Angela Komp & Atty Hilary Edwards.  ADA Thomas Binger stated he will stipulate NGI.  Voir dire commences @ 11:40am.  Jury selected @ 1:25pm.  Unselected jurors released for the day.  Jurors released @ 1:30pm; instructed to return @ 2:30pm.  Jurors reconvene @ 2:59pm.  Jury sworn.  Preliminary instructions given.  Opening statements given.  Testimony commences.  State's witnesses - Gloria M. w/assistance from spanish interpreters Alberto Aguilar & Leo Martin.  Jurors released @ 5:10pm; instructed to return @ 9am on 2/18/20.
Court finds the deft competent to stand trial.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Hilary Edwards & Atty Angela Komp.  Testimony resumes.  Defense witness - Marcel Kudzin (completed direct examination)  Break at noon - parties to return @ 1pm today.  Court reconvenes @ 1:05pm.  Testimony resumes.  Defense witness - Marcel Kudzin (cross examination).  No further evidence from either side.  Arguments heard on the issue of whether the deft is competent to proceed.  Court finds the deft is competent to proceed.  Case to be left on for trial for Monday.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Hilary Edwards & Atty Angela Komp.  Dr. Krystine Jackson (appeared via phone) cross-examination continues.  No further evidence on behalf of the State.  Defense calls Dr. Courtney Endres (via phone).  Break for the day @ 5:20pm.  To resume on 2/13/20 @ 11am with testimony from deft.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Atty Hilary Edwards & Atty Angela Komp appeared on behalf of deft.  Deft not present.  After call to conveyance - conveyance thought the hrg was @ 11am.  Attys to check with their witnesses regarding availability tomorrow.  Both Dr. Jackson & Dr. Endres are both available tomorrow afternoon.  Testimony will resume @ 1:30pm tomorrow.

records.addlTxt: Notification from Court of Appeals regarding receipt of: Notice of Appeal and Circuit Court Record
of Conversion to Civil Commitment Proceedings Under 971.14(6) Wis. Stats.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Hilary Edwards & Atty Carl Johnson.  Corp Counsel Matt Perz present.  Report has been received from Dr. Endres.  Atty Edwards reports the deft stipulates to Dr. Endres' report.  State takes no position.  Deft states he is not competent and is not likely to become competent.  For the reasons set forth on the record, Court finds the deft is not competent at this time.  Deft is discharged from this commitment but shall remain in custody and be taken to mental health facility.  Court orders a report on a quarterly basis being sent to the parties including this court of the status of the deft.  Dept. shall comply with all requirements and the deft shall not be released without 14 day notice being given to this Court and the other proper parties.  Jurisdiction is transferred to the court assigned to handling of Mental Health cases arising under Chapter 51, Stats.   Order of conversion to Civil Commitment Proceedings signed by the Court.  Copy of order provided to Corp Counsel Matt Perz immediately following the hrg.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA James Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Hilary Edwards & Atty Lauren Breckenfelder.  Report has been received from Dr. Pankiewicz.  All parties concur with the finding that the deft is not competent at this time but is likely to become competent w/in a year.  Deft concurs with this finding as well.  However, the deft does NOT stipulate to the medication order.  Defense reports the deft is presently taking his medication voluntarily.  Case is suspended at this time.  Deft is committed to the Dept of Health Services for a period of one year less credit of 197 days.  In the event the court is notified the deft is refusing to take his medication, a hrg will be scheduled forthwith.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Andrea Rufo.  Report has been received from Dr. Pankiewicz.  Dr. Pankiewicz's report states the deft is not presently competent to proceed at this time but is likely to become competent w/in one year with administration of medication.  Attys concur with the findings in the report.  No further evidence presented.  Proceedings are suspended at this time.  Court finds the deft is not presently competent to proceed at this time.  Medication order is ordered.  Court to be notified at least 72 hours in advance of any release from his inpatient committment.  Court finds probable cause exists.
